channel.title: Chapter 2: Doubt on From Draenor With Love
channel.description: Recent content in Chapter 2: Doubt on From Draenor With Love

item.title: Any Similarities are Purely Coincidental
item.description: I just want everyone to know that I combed the Auction House for weeks looking for Ethereum Prison Keys, for reference & accuracy. And they didn‚Äôt help at all. So we came up with something new for the prison spheres, something that would make sense with their role in ethereal society, and with where we encounter them in Blade‚Äôs Edge and Netherstorm. And of course, something that may seem a little familiar.

item.title: The Exchange
item.description: You know what they say: Every ethereal has his price. And remember, these Ethereum guys, they‚Äôre way out of date on their gemstones! Cardinal Rubies, Amberjewels, Lapis Lazulis, Queen‚Äôs Garnets, Primal Diamonds‚Ä¶we‚Äôre talking like, three whole expansions‚Äô worth of exciting new jewels to covet! What self-respecting ethereal could resist such an offer? üòâ Next week will mark the end of Chapter 2! After that, we‚Äôll be taking a short break for some RL vacations and script planning, but we‚Äôll be back before you know it!

item.title: Old Friends
item.description: Vid‚Äôs turn! üòâ For those unfamiliar with what Rades is talking about, he‚Äôs referring to the fact that Rexxar, Vol‚Äôjin and Chen are old war buddies. Years ago (in Warcraft III) they fought together, for Thrall‚Äôs Horde, against the then-leader of Theramore, Daelin Proudmoore (Jaina‚Äôs father), who hated the Horde and wanted to respark the Horde-Alliance war. Considering the situation and players involved in the Siege of Orgrimmar, it seems a bit of a similar situation.

item.title: Let‚Äôs Make a Deal
item.description: Does anyone actually go back to Gezhe each month and get their monthly Membership Benefits? I don‚Äôt, and yet I feel like I almost should ‚Äì the Outlands phase of leveling Jewelcrafting is always such a pain, since those gems are so scarce, and Golden Draenite is actually fairly valuable. And more importantly, I DID do all that work for the Consortium back in the day ‚Äì I EARNED those gems!

item.title: Nagrand Slam
item.description: My favorite moment when crafting a story (such as in a D&D campaign) comes when finally, after months of straightforward, introductory play, all the setup stuff is complete. The plot hooks have been put into play, the important characters have been established, and the overarching story is just starting to pick up speed. I‚Äôve been extra excited about FDWL lately, because I think we‚Äôre at that step. Fun times ahead!

item.title: A Class-ic Mistake
item.description: We don‚Äôt use colour in our pages that often, but man, when we do, it‚Äôs sure a nice contrast with the black & white panels! I don‚Äôt know about you, but I would totally craft a hot pink Sky Golem in-game and fly around in it. This week‚Äôs page is actually canonical ‚Äì it‚Äôs Vid‚Äôs birthday next week! The real Vid, I mean! So be sure to wish her well. To celebrate, she‚Äôs going out of town, so there won‚Äôt be an actual comic page next week.

item.title: Balance
item.description: It of course goes without saying that this song was listened to by both Vid and I during the making of this strip, given the presence of a certain talking chandelier. ‚ÄúMany lives were lost to bring you these tab collars.‚Äù

item.title: Teamwork
item.description: OLD DRAENEI OLD DRAENEI WITH CANES (CANE-EI)

item.title: City of Trite
item.description: I‚Äôd like to tell you that eventually mangling draenic phrases gets old, but I‚Äôd be lying. It‚Äôs one of my favorite things to do. But it‚Äôs not just me! After reading the script, Vid told me she‚Äôs always liked the one that sounds like ‚Äúbuy your niece a car.‚Äù I can‚Äôt wait until Warlords of Draenor where we‚Äôll get even more expressions to abuse!

item.title: Random Encounter
item.description: It‚Äôs the scene from the Chapter Title page, oooooh! Sharp-eyed readers may notice something telling on that page now, too. But what does it mean?? Time will tell. One of the most interesting things about writing FDWL is discussing scenes, and realizing how the events in the comic are letting us establish little character traits about Vid & Rades. We had a good laugh when realizing what type of person Vid (the character) is when she‚Äôs on watch.

item.title: Memory Lane
item.description: After getting swamped last week and falling a bit behind schedule, Vid and I sat down this week and tossed some ideas around on how we could streamline the comic process a little. We realized that something that would help us out a great deal would be adopting a cleaner, more ‚Äúinked‚Äù look. It‚Äôll be a bit of a change from the pages so far, but I‚Äôve always thought Vid‚Äôs art looked super sharp when in the inked-page step, so I‚Äôm actually really glad everyone is getting to see it now!

item.title: Symbols
item.description: Aw yiss, inventing us some headcanon draenei lore! Observant readers may remember that we alluded to these personal symbols back in Vid‚Äôs character profile. If you look at official WoW artwork, there are TONS of different draenei sigils/symbols depicted. Why ARE they different? Do they represent different magical abilities? Or is it like we‚Äôve described here, something biological, like an individual‚Äôs unique DNA footprint? Personally, I think it‚Äôs a lot cooler to imagine those symbols as displays of personal identity rather than just to indicate ‚ÄúI‚Äôm using magic.

item.title: Hit M for Map
item.description: Where‚Äôs the TomTom addon when you need it?

item.title: Chapter Two: Doubt
item.description: Happy New Year, everyone! On to chapter two! I worried how recognizable Zangarmarsh would be in black & white, without those soft, tranquil shades of blue ‚Äì but I suppose those giant mushrooms are pretty distinctive. I‚Äôve always loved Zangarmarsh, it‚Äôs probably my favorite Burning Crusade zone. Not necessarily for the quests or anything ‚Äì it‚Äôs just so soothing and calming visually. Will that carry over for comic-Vid and Rades? I guess you‚Äôll have to wait and find out!
